intro.speaker: Flavia
intro.line: Damn! Look at those walls... This isn't going to be easy.

intro.speaker: Basilio
intro.line: It's not the walls I'm worried about—it's the hordes of Valmese inside them.

intro.speaker: Say'Ri
intro.line: Our best bet is a swift, surgical strike, right at their heart. If we can strike down their commander, the fortress will be ours. So—Khan Flavia, your men will take on the forces surrounded the castle. That should create an opening for a smaller team led by Chrom and I. ...I regret to say this will put you at the forefront of the battle, Sir Chrom.

intro.speaker: Chrom
intro.line: I wouldn't have it any other way.

intro.speaker: Say'Ri
intro.line: Then it's settled. Other Resistance forces are on the way. With luck, they'll arrive in time to help. Let's cleave them a proud trail of imperial blood to find us by!

intro.speaker: Pheros
intro.line: Hmph. Such arrogance... They truly mean to assault Steiger in such meager numbers? Perhaps they expect a woman's garrison to be a softer target,.. Heh, when I'm through, they'll wish they'd challenged Yen'fay instead. Battle stations!

battle.speaker: Say'Ri
battle.line: Sir Chrom—I hear movement from the floor below. It may be reinforcements. Be wary...

battle.speaker: Say'Ri
battle.line: Our comrades! But wait, how...

battle.speaker: Chrom
battle.line: The Resistance had already infiltrated the castle...?

battle.speaker: Say'Ri
battle.line: Nay, impossible! Something is amiss...

battle.speaker: Excellus
battle.line: Oooh, it appears I'm just in time for the Rebellion reunion! Delicious... Please, do give your "friends" your warmest welcome. Just remember your promise...or you can be sure I will remember mine.

battle.speaker: Chrom
battle.line: Say'ri... Are you certain their reinforcements are from the Resistance?

battle.speaker: Say'Ri
battle.line: Aye, sir, I'm ashamed to say I am. I know some of them by name. ...B-but why would they turn cloak against us now?!

battle.speaker: Excellus
battle.line: Oooh, it seems we've touched a nerve! I do so enjoy inappropriate touching... Now be good little servants and scrub the stronghold of these Ylissean filth.

battle.speaker: Pheros
battle.line: What is this meddling, Excellus?!

battle.speaker: Excellus
battle.line: ..."Meddling"? Why, General Pheros, one might almost mistake you for ungrateful. This "meddling" is going to save your post, and quite possibly your life...

battle.speaker: Pheros
battle.line: We've no need of your parlor tricks here, schemer! I can handle this myself.

battle.speaker: Excellus
battle.line: Why yes, of course you can, General! I can see you're doing SO well already. You're obviously just...waiting to crush the Ylisseans? Toying with them, like a cat! I only brought these rebels so they might learn from your shining example! They were so anxious to join the cause...

battle.speaker: Pheros
battle.line: Because you threatened them? Tortured them? ...Or perhaps their families? Their villages?

battle.speaker: Excellus
battle.line: *Ahem* ...I would not wish to burden you with such mundane details, good General. You have more important matters to think after, and to deal with...quickly. But rest assured they are QUITE motivated. Feel free to thank me some other time!

battle.speaker: Pheros
battle.line: Odious freak... He has no honor. Just the sight of him makes me sick. He is the worm, yet I'm the one left squirming... Bah. ...True, his interference may seal our victory...but he'll never hear me say it.

battle.speaker: Soldier
battle.line: General! Sir Excellus is here to see you.

battle.speaker: Excellus
battle.line: Good day to you, General. You look ravishing, as always.

battle.speaker: Pheros
battle.line: Why are you here, trickster?

battle.speaker: Excellus
battle.line: "Trickster"? Why General, it's almost as if you aren't happy to see me! And after I came all this way to help you... I brought friends, you know. Well... perhaps "friends" isn't the word... But they will fight for you all the same.

battle.speaker: Pheros
battle.line: You brought rebels into my stronghold?! Why would they fight their own kind? Unless... You threatened them? Tortured them? ...Or perhaps their families? Their villages?

battle.speaker: Excellus
battle.line: *Ahem* ...I would not wish to burden you with such mundane details, good General. You have more important matters to think after, and to deal with...quickly. But rest assured they are QUITE motivated. Feel free to thank me some other time!

battle.speaker: Pheros
battle.line: Odious freak... He has no honor. Just the sight of him makes me sick. He is the worm, yet I'm the one left squirming... Bah. ...True, his interference may seal our victory...but he'll never hear me say it.

boss.speaker: Pheros
boss.line: In the name of the Conqueror, you shall not take this fortress!

boss.speaker: Pheros
boss.line: Nngh... Well done... I may not live...to see Walhart unify all mankind...with my own eyes... But I have seen it...in my dreams... And that is enough...

boss.speaker: Pheros
boss.line: Then you'd be Prince Chrom... Once, I followed your exalted sister, you know. Made the pilgrimage all the way to Ylisstol, just to hear her speak. I, too, grew up worshiping Naga and the Earth Mother.

boss.speaker: Pheros
boss.line: I have no use for invisible spirits any longer. I serve a god among men now. Emperor Walhart will do what no religion ever could—unite all people.

boss.speaker: Chrom
boss.line: Your naivete betrays you. Think about it: who willingly follows a tyrant?

boss.speaker: Pheros
boss.line: Thinking plays no part in it. In words and deeds, a great leader takes hold of the heart, not the mind. I remember your sister possessing that selfsame gift for inspiring others. Doubtless many still cling to the power of her poetry. But I have found a greater voice...

boss.speaker: Chrom
boss.line: My sister believed we all desire the same thing: peace. If Walhart holds such promise, why must he use violence to unite the people?

boss.speaker: Pheros
boss.line: Now who is being naive, good Prince? Sometimes those who will not walk must be dragged along or pushed aside. So raise your sword, Chrom of Ylisse, and prepare to be pushed aside.

end.speaker: Basilio
end.line: Fall back and form up! Don't let them scatter us!

end.speaker: Flavia
end.line: Rrgh! Easier said than done... Their cavalry is riding right over us!

end.speaker: Basilio
end.line: We can hold our ground... I'll show you how a real Feroxi fights, woman!

end.speaker: Flavia
end.line: Ha! Did I hear a crack in your voice? Is that fear in your eye?

end.speaker: Basilio
end.line: Gah! Never! Let's give these kettleheads a taste of our barbarian roots!

end.speaker: Flavia
end.line: Now THAT'S the oaf I love! ...Huh? Enemy soldiers, there—

end.speaker: Basilio
end.line: They're swatting our troops like flies!

end.speaker: Flavia
end.line: Is it some kind of elite cavalry? No, wait... Gods! It's just one man!

end.speaker: Walhart
end.line: YOU THERE! Do you command these forces?

end.speaker: Basilio
end.line: Awww, crap!

end.speaker: Basilio
end.line: Haaarrrgh... Such...strength... Is he even human...

end.speaker: Walhart
end.line: ...Impressive. You're the first since Yen'fay to survive beyond a single stroke.

end.speaker: Basilio
end.line: I d-don't... I don't stand a chance... Flavia! Everyone! Run! Run for your lives!

end.speaker: Flavia
end.line: I'm not leaving you here!

end.speaker: Basilio
end.line: He's a demon, woman... I can only keep him...busy while you...escape... Hngh! ...D-damn... Looks like the lass was right...

end.speaker: Flavia
end.line: I think not! I'm here, and that means events can be changed! Damn you, oaf! You're not getting away from me that easily!

end.speaker: Flavia
end.line: Basilio!

end.speaker: Basilio
end.line: Nngh... Flavia... Give this to Chrom...

end.speaker: Flavia
end.line: Is this...the Gemstone?!

end.speaker: Basilio
end.line: You have to...survive... G-give it to him...

end.speaker: Flavia
end.line: Give it to him yourself, you one-eyed clod of a man! I'm not going anywhere and neither are you!

end.speaker: Basilio
end.line: Fool woman! I'm f-finished... Don't let it...be for nothing... For once in your life...just do what I say... Go! Go, gods damn you! GOOOOOO!

end.speaker: Flavia
end.line: BASILIO!
